page.title: 12Glenskenno Farm, Montrose.
page.content: {Glenskenno Farm}covers{410 acres}and is owned by Mr.Gall who runs the farm with his father and a tractorman. {Seasonal help}is used to thin turnips and pick stones.{Livestock}includes 51 beef cows, 4 incalf heifers, 2 stock bulls, 4 young bulls, 17 bullocks and 26 heifers for fattening, and 50 calves.{Crops}grown at Glenskenno are winter and spring barley, winter wheat, potatoes, turnips, oil seed rape, and grass.Nowadays,{crop {rotation}is not as strictly adhered to because of the greater profitability in cash crops rather than in livestock. Therefore, less acreage of grass is grown. However, there are certain limitations to how often one can grow a certain crop in the same field due to disease.Potatoes are grown 1yr. in 6 and turnips and oil seed rape 1yr. in 5.
